Detailed Description

AGsr - Global search and replace widget.

AGsr is a search/replace form that inherits from QWidget. Since this simple form does not require a toolbar or a menu, it does not need to inherit from QMainWidget or even QDialog.

See also:
onRun(), onHelp()
Notes:
  • Typically, a single instance of this class is included in the main that starts this application.
  • The AGsrClass is generated by uic. Ui_agsr.h contains the code to generate the form specified by agsr.ui.
  • The run and help buttons are connected up to their respective slots in the constructor.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AGsr::AGsr (  QWidget *  ipParent = 0  ) 
 

AGsr implements the search and replace form.

The AGsr constructor initializes the parent QWidget, and invokes setupUi() to initialize the form. It also reads the user's settings for AGsr. If they are not set, the default settings are used. If help does not work, then the user is notified to make adjustments in the settings. Server scope settings are not used.

Search Expression
The regular expression that is to be matched by the text in the file. See note below.
Replace With
The string that replaces the matched text. See note below.
File Types
Zero or more wildcard expressions that identify the files to be included in the search.
Include Subbirs
Iff checked, include all subdirectories in the search.
Search Only
Iff checked, do not replace matching strings in the text. Just note the number of matches in each file (shown in console window).
See also:
ASr()
Notes:
  1. Qt Designer is used to create the form. Designer creates the XML document agsr.ui.
  2. The uic (UI compiler) uses agsr.ui to generate ui_agsr.h which defines the AGsrClass class, including the setupUI() method that initializes the form.
Regular Expressions.
The following characters have special meaning in a regular expression. If you wish to include the character itself in a search string, prepend a backslash to the character. 
 \ Backslash. Used to escape other characters
 ^ Circumflex. If first char, denotes beg-of-text. Also used as not operator if first char inside brackets.
 $ Dollar sign. If last char, denotes end-of-text
 () Parentheses. Parentheses group subexpressions into one expression.
 . Dot. Matches any character
 * Asterisk. Match zero or more of previous expression.
 + Plus. Match one or more of previous expression.
 ? Question Mark. Matches zero or one of the previous expression.
 {} Braces. Enclose minimum/maximum expression counts.
 [] Brackets. Used to denote a range of characters
 -  Dash. Range separator inside brackets

AGsr::~AGsr (   ) 
 

AGsr destructor.

The destructor is called automatically when an instance of this class goes out of scope (main ends). The position and widget size are saved for the next time that this user starts AGsr.

Notes:
  • The destructor for each member of this class is automatically invoked.
